From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure the Cisco IOS Auto-Upgrade Manager disk cleanup utility, use the **autoupgrade disk-cleanup** command in global configuration mode. To disable this configuration, use the **no** form of this command.
CLIs: autoupgrade disk-cleanup [ crashinfo | core | image | irrecoverable ]
no autoupgrade disk-cleanup [ crashinfo | core | image | irrecoverable ]

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Deletes crashinfo files during disk-cleanup before an image is downloaded.
(Optional) Deletes core files during disk-cleanup before an image is downloaded.
(Optional) Deletes the Cisco IOS images, except the default boot image and the current image, during disk-cleanup before an image is downloaded.
(Optional) Deletes files irretrievably (in a file-system that supports the undelete operation) during disk-cleanup before an image is downloaded.

Examples: The following example shows how to clean-up filesystems that support undelete operation:
The following example shows how to avoid deleting the Cisco IOS software images:

RelatedCmds.description: Configures the URL of the server on www.cisco.com where the image download requests will be sent by Auto-Upgrade Manager.
Configures the address to which the status email is to be sent.
Downloads a Cisco IOS software image directly from www.cisco.com or from a non-Cisco server.
